thread.title: How Has WABCO Performed in a Competitive Market? - Yahoo Finance
thread.title_full: How Has WABCO Performed in a Competitive Market? - Yahoo Finance

author: Gabriel Kane
title: How Has WABCO Performed in a Competitive Market? - Yahoo Finance
text:
US Equity Market Updates for October 22 
( Continued from Prior Part )
WABCO Holdings and its peers Now let’s look at a comparison of WABCO against its peers:
The PE (price-to-earnings) ratios of WABCO Holdings (WBC), General Motors Company (GM), Cummins (CMI), PACCAR (PCAR), and Meritor (MTOR) are 22.9x, 13.1x, 11.75x, 12.1x, and 8.9x, respectively. 
The PBV (price-to-book value) ratios of WABCO, General Motors, Cummins, and PACCAR are 7.80x, 1.61x, 2.55x, and 2.65x, respectively. The PS (price-to-sales) ratios of WABCO, General Motors, Cummins, PACCAR, and Meritor are 2.36x, 0.37x, 1.01x, 0.96x, and 0.29x, respectively. Thus, WABCO Holdings has outperformed its peers based on PE, PBV, and PS.
ETFs that invest in WABCO Holdings The iShares Asia/Pacific Dividend 30 Fund (DVYA) invests 3.0% of its holdings in WABCO. The ETF tracks a dividend-weighted index of 30 of the highest dividend-yielding companies in the Asia-Pacific region.
The PowerShares WilderHill Progressive Energy Portfolio (PUW) invests 2.4% of its holdings in WABCO. The ETF tracks an index of companies that improve near-term use of fossil fuels and nuclear energy. It is weighted equally by sector.
The ALPS International Sector Dividend Dogs (IDOG) invests 2.1% of its holdings in WABCO. The ETF tracks an equal-weighted index that selects the five companies with the highest dividend yield in each of the ten GICS sectors from international developed markets.
Comparing WABCO Holdings and its ETFs Now let’s look at a comparison of WABCO and its ETFs:
The year-to-date price movements of WABCO, DVYA, PUW, and IDOG are 5.0%, -14.7%, -17.3%, and -1.3%, respectively. The PE (price-to-earnings) ratios of WABCO, DVYA, PUW, and IDOG are 22.9x, 15.3x, 84.7x, and 19.5x, respectively. The PBV (price-to-book value) ratios of WABCO, DVYA, PUW, and IDOG are 7.80x, 1.56x, 1.24x and 1.59x, respectively. Thus, WABCO Holdings has outperformed its ETFs based on price movement, PE, and PBV.
